mainBoard.flavorText: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

foreignData.name: Metallischer Remasuri
foreignData.text: Der Metallische Remasuri zählt als Remasuri

foreignData.name: メタリック・スリヴァー

mainBoard.name: Metallic Sliver
mainBoard.originalText: Metallic Sliver counts as a Sliver.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."
—Hanna, *Weatherlight* navigator

foreignData.name: Klumpenremasuri
foreignData.text: Alle Remasuris erhalten "{2}:Regeneration"

mainBoard.name: Clot Sliver
mainBoard.originalText: Each Sliver gains "o2: Regenerate this creature."

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

mainBoard.text: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

mainBoard.name: Mindwhip Sliver
mainBoard.originalText: Each Sliver gains "o2, Sacrifice this creature: Target player discards a card at random. Play this ability as a sorcery."

rulings.text: If you cast a Sliver as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you’ll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you’ll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

foreignData.name: Vorzeichen
foreignData.text:
Schaue Dir die obersten drei Karten der Bibliothek eines Spielers Deiner Wahl an.
Mische diese Bibliothek neu oder lege diese Karten in beliebiger Reihenfolge zurück auf die Bibliothek. Ziehe eine Karte zu Beginn des nächsten Zuges.

mainBoard.name: Portent
mainBoard.originalText: Look at the top three cards of target player's library. Shuffle that library or put those three cards back on top of it in any order. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

rulings.text: This does not cause a player to lose if they have less than 3 cards in their library. It allows you to look at and reorder or shuffle whatever remaining cards there might be.

mainBoard.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

foreignData.name: Kraftverlust
foreignData.text: Neutralisiere einen Zauberspruch Deiner Wahl, wenn dessen Urheber nicht sofort X ausgibt. Wenn er dies nicht tut, tappe alle manaproduzierenden Länder, die dieser Spieler kontrolliert und entleere seinen Manavorrat.

mainBoard.name: Power Sink
mainBoard.originalText:
Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional o
X. If he or she does not, tap all mana-producing lands that player controls and remove all mana from his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not “tapped for mana”. If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I followed her song only to find it was a dirge."
—Crovax

mainBoard.name: Whispers of the Muse
mainBoard.originalText:
Buyback o5 (You may pay an additional o5 when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Draw a card.
mainBoard.text:
Buyback {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Draw a card.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell.

foreignData.name: Dunkler Sog
foreignData.text: X: Der Dunkle Sog fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl X Schadenspunkte zu. Du kannst nur schwarzes Mana auf diese Art ausgeben. Du erhältst 1 Lebenspunkt für jeden Schadenspunkt, der auf diese Art zugefügt wird. Du kannst nicht mehr Lebenspunkte, als die Widerstandskraft der Kreatur beträgt oder als die Anzahl der Lebenspunkte des Spielers, dem mit dem Dunklen Sog Schaden zugefügt wurde, erhalten.

mainBoard.name: Drain Life
mainBoard.originalText:
oo
X Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. Spend only black mana in this way. Gain 1 life for each 1 damage dealt, but not more than the toughness of the creature or the life total of the player Drain Life damages.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

mainBoard.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi

foreignData.name: Impuls
foreignData.text: Schaue Dir die obersten vier Karten Deiner Bibliothek an. Nimm eine davon auf deine Hand und lege die übrigen unter deine Bibliothek.

mainBoard.name: Impulse
mainBoard.originalText: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.
This is not a draw.

mainBoard.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

foreignData.name: Terror
foreignData.text: Begrabe die Zielkreatur. Dieser Zauber hat keine Wirkung auf schwarze Kreaturen und Artefaktkreaturen.

mainBoard.originalText: Bury target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.

foreignData.name: Lobotomie
foreignData.text: Schaue Dir die Karten auf der Hand eines Spielers Deiner Wahl an und bestimme eine beliebige Karte davon außer einem Standardland. Durchsuche die Hand, den Friedhof und die Bibliothek des Spielers nach allen Kopien der gewählten Karte und entferne diese ganz aus dem Spiel. Der Spieler mischt danach seine Bibliothek neu.

mainBoard.name: Lobotomy
mainBoard.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose any of those cards other than a basic land. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of the chosen card and remove them from the game. That player shuffles his or her library afterwards.

rulings.text: Does not affect cards on the battlefield.
If the player has no cards in their hand, you still get to look through their deck, but you do not get to exile any cards.
It exiles the chosen card plus all others in the hand, library, and graveyard. Some people thought the chosen card was not exiled due to some vague wording.
You only get to pick one card from the player’s hand.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

mainBoard.text: Target player reveals their hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles.

rulings.text: You don't sacrifice Nevinyrral's Disk to activate its ability. It's destroyed as part of the ability's resolution if it's still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral's Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it stays on the battlefield.

foreignData.text: Alle Artefakte erhalten die Eigenschaft ""Bezahle während Deiner Versorgungsphase zusätzlich 2 oder begrabe dieses Artefakt.

sideBoard.name: Energy Flux
sideBoard.originalText: All artifacts gain "During your upkeep, pay o2 or bury this artifact."
sideBoard.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

foreignData.name: Düsternis
foreignData.text: Weiße Zaubersprüche kosten zusätzlich 3. Aktivierungskosten von weißen Verzauberungen kosten zusätzlich 3.

sideBoard.name: Gloom
sideBoard.originalText: White spells cost an additional o3 to play. Activated abilities of white enchantments cost an additional o3 to play.

rulings.text: The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

sideBoard.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"We can fight with you or against you. After my day, I'd prefer the former."
—Gerrard of the *Weatherlight*

foreignData.name: Einblicke
foreignData.text: Immer wenn ein Gegner Deiner Wahl einen grünen Zauberspruch erfolgreich spricht, ziehe eine Karte.

sideBoard.name: Insight
sideBoard.originalText: Whenever target opponent successfully casts a green spell, draw a card.
sideBoard.text: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.

foreignData.name: Nekropotenz
foreignData.text:
Übergehe Deine Kartenziehphase.
Wenn Du eine Karte abwirfst, wird sie ganz aus dem Spiel entfernt.
Zahle 1 Lebenspunkte: Lege die oberste Karte Deiner Bibliothek beiseite. Nimm diese Karte zu Beginn Deiner nächsten Abwurf-Phase auf deine Hand.

sideBoard.name: Necropotence
sideBoard.originalText:
Skip your draw phase.
Whenever you discard a card, remove that card from the game.
Pay 1 life: Set aside the top card of your library. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your discard phase.

rulings.text: If a discarded card isn't put into your graveyard (due to an effect such as that of Obstinate Baloth) or leaves your graveyard (perhaps because another effect returned it to your hand), it won't be exiled.
If you discard a card with madness and wish to cast it, Necropotence's ability won't exile that card. If you don't wish to cast it, you choose whether it ends up exiled or in your graveyard.

Necropotence's last ability creates a delayed triggered ability that will put the exiled card into your hand. That ability still triggers even if Necropotence is removed from the battlefield before your end step.
You can't look at the cards exiled by the last ability while they're face down.

sideBoard.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle *en*-Vec

foreignData.name: Untergang
foreignData.text: Zerstöre alle grünen Kreaturen. Diese Kreaturen können in diesem Zug nicht regenerieren.

sideBoard.name: Perish
sideBoard.originalText: Destroy all green creatures. Those creatures cannot be regenerated this turn.
sideBoard.text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more."
—Volrath, to Karn

foreignData.name: Propaganda
foreignData.text: Kreaturen können nicht angreifen, wenn ihr Beherrscher nicht zusätzlich {2} für diese Kreatur bezahlt.

sideBoard.name: Propaganda
sideBoard.originalText: Each turn, each creature cannot attack you unless its controller pays an additional o2 for that creature.

rulings.text: If there are multiple attacks in a turn, then you have to pay for each attack.
If there is more than one Propaganda on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.
Paying this cost is not an instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.
The payment is made during the declare attackers step at the same time you are declaring the attacker.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

sideBoard.text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."
—Jolrael

foreignData.name: Nekrataal
foreignData.text:
Erstschlag
Wenn der Nekrataal ins Spiel kommt, begrabe eine nichtschwarze Nicht-Artefaktkreatur Deiner Wahl.

sideBoard.name: Nekrataal
sideBoard.originalText:
First strike
When Nekrataal comes into play, bury target nonartifact, nonblack creature.

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it’s a creature you control.

sideBoard.text:
First strike
When Nekrataal enters, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

foreignData.name: Lebende Tote
foreignData.text: Lege alle Kreaturenkarten aus allen Friedhöfen zur Seite. Lege dann jede Kreatur, die im Spiel ist, auf die Friedhöfe ihrer Besitzer. Bringe danach alle Kreaturen, die auf diese Art zur Seite gelegt wurden, direkt unter der Kontrolle ihrer Besitzer ins Spiel.

sideBoard.name: Living Death
sideBoard.originalText: Set aside all creature cards in all graveyards. Then, put each creature that is in play into its owner's graveyard. Then, put each creature card set aside in this way into play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: As Living Death resolves, all players exile their creature cards from graveyards at the same time. Then all players sacrifice all creatures they control at the same time. Then all players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield at the same time.

Only cards exiled by Living Death's first instruction are put onto the battlefield. If a replacement effect (such as that of Leyline of the Void) causes any of the sacrificed creatures to be exiled instead of put into a graveyard, those cards aren't returned to the battlefield.

sideBoard.text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.
